DataElement.preferredName: Speech Phonological Awareness Test Syllable Repetition Task Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The exchange of spoken words._A test to assess the ability of the respondent to repeat multi-syllable nonsense words. It is is used to assess an individual's ability to code and temporarily store information phonologically. This ability is related to verbal memory and language acquisition._An 18-item imitation task that assesses a speaker's ability to repeat nonwords. This nonword repetition task was designed specifically for speakers whose incomplete inventories invalidate use of conventional nonword repetition tasks and/or who have speech production patterns that are difficult to transcribe and score._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Speech; the exchange of spoken words.

Property.preferredName: Phonological Awareness Test Syllable Repetition Task
Property.preferredDefinition: A test to assess the ability of the respondent to repeat multi-syllable nonsense words. It is is used to assess an individual's ability to code and temporarily store information phonologically. This ability is related to verbal memory and language acquisition.:An 18-item imitation task that assesses a speaker's ability to repeat nonwords. This nonword repetition task was designed specifically for speakers whose incomplete inventories invalidate use of conventional nonword repetition tasks and/or who have speech production patterns that are difficult to transcribe and score.

Concepts.definition: A test to assess the ability of the respondent to repeat multi-syllable nonsense words. It is is used to assess an individual's ability to code and temporarily store information phonologically. This ability is related to verbal memory and language acquisition.

An 18-item imitation task that assesses a speaker's ability to repeat nonwords. This nonword repetition task was designed specifically for speakers whose incomplete inventories invalidate use of conventional nonword repetition tasks and/or who have speech production patterns that are difficult to transcribe and score.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ReferenceDocuments.name: Syllable Repetition Task (SRT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Syllable Repetition Task (SRT) is an 18-item task to assess the ability to repeat nonwords. Administrator presses the down arrow key to progress through the test stimuli in PowerPoint. Each test item (nonword) will appear on the PC screen in the order on the SRT Scoring Form. The screen should not be visible to the respondent, as the task is purely an auditory one. Every time the recording says a nonword, the respondent is to attempt to say the nonword.
